alert.note: Alert for Clay (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued February 19 at 6:08PM CST until February 20 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM TO 6 PM CST SUNDAY... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS EXPIRED... * WHAT...Snow and blowing snow expected. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Total snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...In North Dakota, Cass County. In Minnesota, Clay County. * WHEN...From 6 AM to 6 PM CST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. The cold wind chills as low as 20 below zero could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 30 minutes.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for North Dakota can be found at dot.nd.gov/travel and for Minnesota at 511mn.org, or by calling 5 1 1 in either state.
